attributes.comment:
With regards to the proposal to increase fees for Orphan Petitions/Fingerprints, I
would like to request a detailed explanation of why the fees are increasing. It
appears that this is an arbitrary increase, and possibly completely unnecessary.
The United States prodes itself on being a goodwill ambassador to all nations. We
continue and perhaps folster that reputation via international adoptions. Many birth
parents in other countries dream of allowing their children to live, grow, and be
educated in the United States. They know that there are opportunities and
freedoms here that they cannot gurantee their children in their countries of origin.
Increasing these fees will only make it more difficult for loving American families to
extend the hand of goodwill towards these countries via adoption.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Diane Kampf
